intro: Aspicarpa lanata, commonly known as the woolly aspicarpa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woolly stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its small, pale yellow flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences. Aspicarpa lanata is often found in dry, arid environments and is adapted to thrive in poor soils.
